meanings.definition: A foul-smelling organic compound produced during the decomposition of animal and plant matter.
meanings.sent1: The putrescine emitted a strong odor as the organic matter decayed.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the putrescine found in decaying plants to understand the decomposition process.
meanings.sent3: The putrescine in the compost heap made the gardener wrinkle his nose in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The putrescine hanging in the air was a reminder of the cycle of life and death.
meanings.sent5: The putrescine smell was so pungent that it lingered in the room for days.

meanings.sent1: If left unattended, the fruit will putrescine and attract flies.
meanings.sent2: Leaves putrescine quickly when they fall from the trees in autumn.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich started to putrescine in the lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: Neglected food can putrescine and become a breeding ground for bacteria.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house began to putrescine, slowly returning to the earth.
